title: This JSON Schema file was generated from ./NexSIS/xsd-cisu/location-type.xsd on Wed Feb 08 2023 22:31:00 GMT+0100 (Central European Standard Time).  For more information please see http://www.xsd2jsonschema.org
description: Schema tag attributes: xmlns:xs='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema' elementFormDefault='qualified' targetNamespace='urn:emergency:cisu:2.0' xmlns:ns1='urn:emergency:cisu:2.0'

other.description: A place without a registered place type representation.

aircraft.description: A device that is used or intended to be used for flight in the air, such as an airplane, helicopter, gyroplane, glider, or lighter-than-air devices like a balloon.

airport.description: A place from which aircrafts operate, such as an airport or heliport.

arena.description: Enclosed area used for sports events.

automobile.description: An automotive vehicle, usually four-wheeled, designed for passenger transportation, such as a car

bank.description: Business establishment in which money is kept for saving, commercial purposes, is invested, supplied for loans, or exchanged.

bicyle.description: A vehicle with two wheels tandem, a steering handle, a saddle seat, and pedals by which it is propelled.

bus.description: A large motor vehicle designed to carry passengers.

bus-station.description: Terminal that serves bus passengers, such as a bus depot or bus terminal.

cafe.description: Usually a small and informal establishment that serves various refreshments (such as coffee); coffee shop.

government.description: Government building, such as those used by the legislative, executive, or judicial branches of governments, including court houses, police stations, and military installations.

hospital.description: Hospital, hospice, medical clinic, mental institution, or doctor's office.

hotel.description: Hotel, motel, inn, or other lodging establishment.

industrial.description: Industrial setting, such as a manufacturing floor or power plant.

library.description: Library or other public place in which literary and artistic materials, such as books, music, periodicals, newspapers, pamphlets, prints, records, and tapes, are kept for reading, reference, or lending.

motorcycle.description: A two-wheeled automotive vehicle, including a scooter.

office.description: Business setting, such as an office.

other.description: A place without a registered place type representation.

outdoors.description: Outside a building, in or into the open air, such as a park or city streets.

parking.description: A parking lot or parking garage.

place-of-worship.description: A religious site where congregations gather for religious observances, such as a church, chapel, meetinghouse, mosque, shrine, synagogue, or temple.

prison.description: Correctional institution where persons are confined while on trial or for punishment, such as a prison, penitentiary, jail, brig.

public.description: Public area such as a shopping mall, street, park, public building, train station, or airport or in public conveyance such as a bus, train, plane, or ship. This general description encompasses the more precise descriptors 'street', 'public- transport', 'aircraft', 'bus', 'bus-station', 'train', 'train- station', 'airport', 'shopping-area', 'outdoors', and 'watercraft'.

public-transport.description: Any form of public transport, including aircraft, bus, train, or ship.

residence.description: A private or residential setting, not necessarily the personal residence of the entity, e.g., including a friend's home.

restaurant.description: Restaurant, coffee shop, or other public dining establishment.

school.description: School or university property, but not necessarily a classroom or library.

shopping-area.description: Shopping mall or shopping area. This area is a large, often enclosed, shopping complex containing various stores, businesses, and restaurants usually accessible by common passageways.

stadium.description: Large, usually open structure for sports events, including a racetrack.

store.description: Place where merchandise is offered for sale, such as a shop.

street.description: A public thoroughfare, such as an avenue, street, alley, lane, or road, including any sidewalks.

theater.description: Theater, lecture hall, auditorium, classroom, movie theater, or similar facility designed for presentations, talks, plays, music performances, and other events involving an audience.

train.description: Train, monorail, maglev, cable car, or similar conveyance.

train-station.description: Terminal where trains load or unload passengers or goods; railway station, railroad station, railroad terminal, train depot.

truck.description: An automotive vehicle suitable for hauling, used primarily to carry goods rather than people.

underway.description: In a land-, water-, or aircraft that is underway (in motion).

unknown.description: The type of place is unknown.

warehouse.description: Place in which goods or merchandise are stored, such as a storehouse or self-storage facility.

water.description: In, on, or above bodies of water, such as an ocean, lake, river, canal, or other waterway.

watercraft.description: On a vessel for travel on water such as a boat or ship.
